= Module : BioPHP =

This is mainly a example module, nothing is actually really field tested, however some functions, or classes might actually help ppl to find there way around easy bio-informatic problems.

== Module overview ==
 * core part, this contains basic manipulations to dna/rna/peptides
 * fasta part, this contains write/read functions for fasta files

== 1 Core part ==
location : /root/main/_modules/biophp/biophp.php

==== dna_to_rna ====
This function will replace T with U.
function param :
{{{
function dna_to_rna ( $dna )
}}}

==== mrna_to_triplet ====
This function will simply split up mra in a triplet, you can set an offset using the second parameter, this however is optional (default : 0)

function param :
{{{
function mrna_to_triplet ( $mrna, $offset )
}}}

function return :
{{{
array
}}}

==== triplet_to_peptide ====
This function will return the peptide that matches the given triplet
function param :
{{{
function triplet_to_peptide ( $triplet )
}}}

==== is_dna ====
checks if a string only contains ATCG

==== is_rna ====
checks if a string only contains AUCG

== 2 Fasta part ==
location : /root/main/_modules/biophp/inc/fasta.php

==== read_fasta ====
This function can read fasta sequence, given in a string (use file_get_contents(), not file()). It will return the header (or headers), sequence(s), and parse info collected during read procedure.

function param :
{{{
function read_fasta( $source )
}}}

function return :
{{{
array( $header, $sequence, $parse_info);
}}}

==== write_fasta ====
This function will write collected information to a regular fasta file, you can add sequence parameters, name of file, sequence, and a extension (by default .fasta is taken).

function param :
{{{
function write_fasta( $param, $name, $seq, $ext )
}}}
